dialogues.text: Apparently the White House shares our curiosity - they have also launched an investigation, and, according to our sources, neither the F.B.I. nor the C.I.A. has met with success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Clearly, such interest on their part is of great political significance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, yes comrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm... Take this down.  (Karpatov takes out notepad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this quote included in the Tass coverage; 'Chauncey Gardiner, in an intimate discussion with Ambassador Skrapinov, noted that "Unless the leaders of the opposing political systems move the chairs on which they sit closer to each other, all of their seats will be pulled from under them by rapid social and political changes."'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Your Excellency. Karpatov leaves the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same lounge as before. Sidney Courtney sits at the sa table as earlier, only this time with the editor of the Washington Post, LYMAN STUART. Courtney puffs on his pipe he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's strictly rumor at this stage, Lyman - just something in the wind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something rather big in the wind, I'd say. So whose files were destroyed? The CIA's or the FBI's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Like I said, it's just rumor so far, but we should start nosing around, see if we can talk to some people... The CAMERA begins to slowly MOVE AWAY from their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But why? The question is why? Why would they destroy Gardiner's files? What is it about his past they are trying to cover up? (his voice fades)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A criminal record? A membership in a subversive organization? Homosexual, perhaps? The SOUND of Stuart's voice dissolves into Thomas Frankli as the CAMERA SETTLES on Dr. Allenby and Franklin sitting a table nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And he told us that he had been living there since he was a child, working as a gardener. He showed us a room in the garage, where he said he stayed, and I... Well, I didn't really believe him, of course - but why the act?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another thing that baffles me, Doctor - what was his connection with the deceased? Major financial dealings, obviously - but our firm has no record of any such transactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. You say he showed you his garden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he said it was his, he walked us through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  (leans close to Franklin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Franklin, I must ask you and Miss Hayes to keep this incident with Mr. Gardiner to yourselves. There's no telling what he was involved in, and the matter may be extremely confidential. So please, not a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Doctor, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Thank you, Mr. Franklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, glad to be of help. Allenby rises, leaves the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Sophie are talking to a small group. Chance moves away to get an hors d'oeuvre and is approached by RONALD STIEGLER, a publisher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gardiner, I'm Ronald Stiegler, of Harvard Books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a two-handed handshake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gardiner, my editors and I have been wondering if you'd consider writing a book for us? Something on your political philosophy. What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, who can nowadays? I have trouble writing a post card to my children! Look, we could give you a six figure advance, provide you with the very best ghostwriter, research assistants, proof readers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not! No one has the time to read! One glances at things, watches television...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I like to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do! No one reads!... Listen, book publishing isn't exactly a bed of roses these days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mild interest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of bed is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rand is in bed. Sitting nearby are two attorneys, MONROE TOWNSEND. Mrs. Aubrey stands to one side and Constance an Teresa prepare an IV for Rand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaks slowly, with effort)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. I said everything and that's exactly what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mr. Rand, the holdings are so extensive, I would like to be more precise in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could be more precise than everything...? Allenby enters the room, stands by the door, unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Townsend)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything to Mrs. Rand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drafting a will)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right - everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two don't have to lecture me on the complexities of the situation, no one knows that better than myself... But you must understand that I have an endless faith in Mrs. Rand's abilities - I know that she will select the right person for guidance when she has the need... She has shared my life, gentlemen, she has given me far more pleasure than any of my so called assets... Life has suddenly become very simple for me now - I may be older than my years, and you might think me to be somewhat feeble... But I am still in love, gentlemen, thank God for that... Allenby silently leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis Watson, of the State Department, talks with Chance a corner of the living room. Dennis whispers something in Chance's ear and Chance gives him an innocent smile. Denn is encouraged by the smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could do it now, we can go upstairs. (no reaction from Chance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Please, it's time for us. Come upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blankly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch? You mean just watch me? Doing it alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I like to watch very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if that's what you want, then I want it too. (takes Chance's arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to tell Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Eve? You mean Mrs. Rand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling Chance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you can tell her later. She'll never miss you in this crowd. Dennis leads Chance out of the crowded room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light from the adjoining bathroom filters into the dark bedroom. The President and the First Lady are in bed. The each lie on their backs, a distance apart and are silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after some time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Maybe you should talk to somebody, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that won't do any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (another pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Is it me? Is there something I've done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, sweetheart - it's not you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (another pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your damn job. It never happened when you were a senator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that, I just... The inter-White House phone rings, the President reaches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Kaufman - what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, we have a break in the case. Our man at the Washington Post says they are working on a story that either the CIA or the FBI destroyed Gardiner's files before anyone could get to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say at this time - neither agency will admit to a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting out of bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, get both Directors over here, I'll be right down. The President hangs up the phone as the First Lady stares the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room exquisitely decorated in pale lilac tapestry The lights are very dim, and Dennis, who we cannot see, i lying on the floor. Dennis' clothes are draped over a cha Chance sees a very small pocket television on a desk. He turns the TV on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squints at small screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, very well, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's very tiny, but it's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed at it being 'tiny')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Are you sure you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do, it's very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Really!!! Chance reacts to the change in tone of Dennis' voice, tur to look at him on the floor. Hearing the groans and heavy breathing, Chance thinks Dennis is ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need a doctor? I could call Robert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the groans)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your foot! Give me your foot!! Dennis reaches out with his free hand, grabs Chance's foo pulls it to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (some pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. But my leg is still a little sore.  Chance watches as Dennis goes through some spasms, then h body relaxes. Chance is concerned for Dennis' health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're not ill? We hear a contented sigh from the man on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, black limousine with a Red Star on the door pulls away from Sophie's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEXIS NOVOGROD, a high-ranking KGB officer, and two of h underlings are in the limousine, along with Skrapinov, hi wife and Karpatov. Novogrod and his men wear heavy clothi fresh from Moscow. They all drink vodka. (Dialogue in Russian, English subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rank-and-file in the FBI feel he is FBI, but others feel he is a CIA man who knows how to destroy FBI files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be possible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we are quite certain, comrade, that this man Gardiner is a leading member of an American elitist faction planning a coup d'etat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coup d'etat! Of course, that was foreseen by Lenin himself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is correct, Comrade Skrapinov. We have ascertained that Gardiner heads a big-business power group that will soon be taking over the American government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big business. I could work with that faction quite nicely, Colonel Novogrod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have proven that already, Comrade Skrapinov, you are to be congratulated for recognizing the importance of this man and establishing an early friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us toast to the success of the coup. They all raise their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Na zdorov'e! The men and Mrs. Skrapinov drink their vodkas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception is breaking up. Eve, wearing her coat, sear for Chance in the crowd. She sees him, taps him on the shoulder from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chauncey, where have you been? I was afraid you got bored and left, or that you were with some mysterious woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was with a man. We went upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs? Chauncey, you're always involved in some sort of discussion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was very ill, I stayed with him for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be the punch, and it is stuffy in here -- I feel it a little myself. You're an angel, my dear - thank God there are still men like you around to give aid and comfort. Eve and Chance leave the reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President sits behind his desk in a bathrobe, his hai mussed. Standing before him are GROVER HONEYCUTT, the Director of the F.B.I., and CLIFFORD BALDWIN, C.I.A. Chie Kaufman stands to one side. All are red-eyed, tired, and frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never gave such a directive, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor I, sir - it would be out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I didn't call you here at such an hour to make accusations, I just want to explore the possibilities. Now, I have three questions; Is the man a foreign agent? Or, have we suddenly found that our methods of gathering data are grossly inefficient? Or, thirdly, have the man's files been destroyed? Now, I'd like some answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gardiner is not a foreign agent, there are now sixteen countries investigating the man. We can rule that out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well... Can we rule out inefficiency...? There is silence in the room. A couple of looks, but sile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. What about question three? Is it possible to erase all traces of a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highly unlikely, sir... In fact, the boys around the Bureau feel that the only person capable of pulling it off would be an ex F.B.I. man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look to Honeycutt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's entirely true, Grover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Baldwin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do the boys around Intelligence think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. President... They don't quite know what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, needless to say, there is going to be a full Congressional investigation of your respective operations. (goes to door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. The President leaves the Oval Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Chance walk down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so close to you, so safe with you, Chauncey... (stops at her bedroom door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And Benjamin understands that, dearest... He understands and accepts my feelings for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Eve. Ben is very wise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens her door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Come in, Chauncey - please come in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Chance enters, Eve closes the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve turns on a soft lamp, Chance goes directly to her TV, turns it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can sense that you've been through a lot, Chauncey. But one day, when you feel like it, you'll tell me all about your life... (Chance watches an old movie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But, even if you tell me nothing, even if it's too painful for you to reveal your past... As she talks, Chance watches a love scene on TV. The hero gives his lady a passionate kiss and embrace. The scene s to 'sink into' Chance's mind. He abruptly turns, takes Ev into his arms and kisses her full on the mouth. Just as abruptly, he turns away and changes channels on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Chauncey... I do love you so much! She takes Chance in her arms, kisses him wildly. They fal her bed in an embrace. As she holds him, kisses him, runs hands over his body, Chance watches television, neither resists nor responds to Eve's caresses. Suddenly she stop lets her head fall on Chance's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You don't want me, Chauncey... You don't feel anything for me... Nothing at all... Chance sits up on the bed, then, feeling her sadness, gen strokes her hair as he looks at TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't excite you at all... I don't know what you want... I don't know what you like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not understanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To watch...? To watch me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I like to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Is that all you want...? (a hesitation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... To watch me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's very good, Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But I've never done... (another hesitation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You mean...? When... When... When I do it? ... When I touch myself...? Eve slowly gets up from the bed, nervously paces the bedr as Chance watches TV. She makes a decision, moves to Chan kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting aroused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Chauncey... She steps back, slips off her dress. She does not undress further, instead, leans close to Chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those little things you don't know about me yet, darling - I'm a little shy. She smiles, gets in bed and pulls the covers over herself Chance divides his attention between Eve and the TV, watc both with an equal detachment. Eve begins to respond to h own touch, finds a heretofore undiscovered pleasure with own body. Chance changes the channel as she reaches orgas As Eve's body trembles, Chance yawns, gets up from the be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Eve. A low purr is heard from Eve as Chance leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allenby, Constance and Teresa are readying a transfusion Rand. There is a feeling of urgency as they work. Rand, very weak, strains to speak to Allenby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more, Robert... No more needles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits on the side of the bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good, Ben - I'm sure you can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Robert... But, strangely enough, I don't feel too bad about now... I feel all right... I guess it's easier... knowing Chauncey is here... to take care of things... Teresa is about to swab Rand's arm with alcohol but he pu away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want any of that... Please... please, just get me Mr. Gardiner, Teresa - please... he'll head it up... Teresa looks to Allenby, he nods to her. Teresa puts the cotton down, leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light snow is failing. Eve is in a fur coat, holds a steaming cup of coffee. Chance stands next to her, an umbrella in one hand. He holds his other arm out, catchin the snowflakes as they fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And I feel so free now, Chauncey. Until I met you, I never felt acknowledged by a man...  (Chance gazes out at the falling snow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I always had the feeling that I was just a vessel for a man, someone that he could take hold of, pierce, and pollute. I was merely an aspect of somebody's lovemaking. Do you know what I mean? Chance turns to her, says nothing, presses the cold snowflakes to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (presses close to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dearest, you uncoil my wants; desire flows within me, and when you watch me my passion dissolves it. You set me free. I reveal myself to myself and I am drenched and purged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very interesting, Eve. Teresa appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gardiner. Mr. Rand would like to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I would like to see Ben. Chance gives Eve a warm smile, then follows Teresa into t house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allenby, with nothing more he can do to prolong Rand's li sits on the bed close to him, grips his hand tightly. Ter shows Chance into the room and Allenby motions to the nur to leave. As they do, Chance, once again breathing the ox with a smile, goes to Rand's bedside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Chauncey... Chauncey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Ben - are you going to die now? Allenby winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a weak smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm about to surrender the Horn of Plenty for the Horn of Gabriel, my boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches out to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me feel the strength in your hand, Chauncey... Let me feel your strength... (holds Chance's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's good... I hope, Chauncey - I hope that you'll stay with Eve... Take care of her, watch over her, she's a delicate flower, Chauncey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cares for you and she needs your help, Chauncey... there's much to be looked after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I would like to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I've worked very hard and enjoyed my life... I've known success... and I've felt love... My associates, Chauncey - I've talked with them about you... They're eager to meet you... very eager to meet you... I'm very fond of you, Chauncey... And I understand Eve... Tell her that... tell her I'm madly in love with her... Rand slumps down, dead. Allenby checks his pulse, turns t Chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He's gone, Chauncey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Robert. I have seen it before. It happens to old people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covers Rand's face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I suppose that's true. Chance reaches out, uncovers Rand's face, gently touches man's forehead, feels the coldness. Allenby eyes him as Chance stays with Rand for a moment, then replaces the sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Allenby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be leaving now, Robert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a day or two, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is going to stay. The house will not be closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a moment, a look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You've become quite a close friend of Eve's - haven't you Mr... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Chance...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I love Eve very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... (another beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And you are really a gardener, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Robert - I am. (a smile at Allenby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go tell Eve about Ben now, Robert. Chance leaves the bedroom. Allenby watches him go, then s back in a chair, his head spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloudy, cold day patches of snow are on the ground. The Rand servants are lined up in front of the mansion, liste funeral services for Rand on a pair of loudspeakers. PAN AROUND, reveal the services being held on a hill overlook the mansion. Fifty mourners are gathered around the Rand family mausoleum. Chance stands with Eve and Allenby. The President of the United States stands before a microphone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Millions of people across the world have heard of the passing of Benjamin Rand; but, unfortunately, only relatively few will feel the pain and sadness at such a loss. To most, Benjamin Rand was a legend; to those of us gathered here today, Benjamin was a beloved friend. My personal association with Benjamin dates back many years, and my memories of our friendship will stay with me forever. As the President speaks, Chance turns and walks away. Eve Allenby watch as he goes into the trees surrounding the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I initially came in contact with the Rand name in 1943. 1 was a young lieutenant in the Air Corps, a navigator flying missions over Europe. That plane that I learned to know so well was manufactured by the Rand Aeronautics Corporation. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin Rand was an industrial giant, known to be powerful and uncompromising, and yet, on a personal level, we have all felt his warmth and humor... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I would like to share with you a few quotes, and a few feelings from our dear friend. (holds up paper, reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 'I do not regret having political differences with men that I respect; I do regret, however, that our philosophies kept us apart.' ... 'I have no use for those on welfare, no patience whatsoever... But, if I am to be honest with myself, I must admit that they have no use for me, either.' ... 'I was born into a position of extreme wealth, I have spent many sleepless nights thinking about extreme poverty -  I do not know the feelings of being poor, and that is not to know the feelings of the majority of people in this world. For a man in my position, that is inexcusable.'  'Life is a state of mind.' ... 'When I was a boy, I was told that the Lord fashioned us from his own image. That's when I decided to manufacture mirrors.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah auditorium with row upon row of empty seats. Huddled together at one end of the hall are six important businessmen, speaking in hushed tones. JAMES DUDLEY, a powerful industrialist, speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what do we know of the man? Nothing! We have no inkling of his past! SEWELL NELSON, a corporation chairman, joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct, and that is an asset. A man's past can cripple him, his background turns into a swamp and invites scrutiny. Another executive, PETER CALDWELL, agrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To this time, he hasn't said anything that could be used against him. CHARLIE BOB BENNET, a Texas oil millionaire;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm certainly open to the thought - it would be sheer lunacy to support the President for another term.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will go along with that... Look at the facts, gentlemen, the response from his appearance on 'This Evening' was overwhelming; he has excited and awakened the people of this country at a time of despair. LYMAN MURRAY, a banker;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's personable, elusive, yet seemingly honest. He's riding a crest of popularity that builds with every statement. As far as his thinking goes, he appears to be one of us. I firmly believe, gentlemen, that he is our only chance - Mr. Chauncey Gardiner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance, his umbrella under his arm, walks through the woo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The services are over. Eve, Allenby talk with the Preside and the First Lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was very moving, Bobby - thank you so much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all going to miss him, Eve...  (glances around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Where's Mr. Gardiner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He walked off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chauncey is so sensitive... He was overcome with grief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can certainly understand that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... I'm so sorry for you, Eve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you soon. The President and First Lady head toward their limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance walks deeper into the woods, absorbed in the green He stops by a tree, brushes some snow from a branch, move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The majority of mourners have left. Eve and Allenby walk slowly to the RAND 1 limousine, look around for Chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do you think we should look for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, he should be along soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish he were here... Eve keeps looking as they walk to the limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance happens on a tree with a cracked limb, hanging to ground. He stops, inspects the break, runs his fingers al the split in the bark. He looks to the ground, notices th an end of the limb has fallen on a seedling, bending it double. Chance pulls the limb away, then kneels beside th seedling. He removes an expensive paid of suede gloves, a with gentle fingers, brushes the dirt and snow away from seedling. Chance glances up to the remaining limbs of the larger tree which could fall and threaten the emerging tr He unfolds his umbrella, places it over the seedling in a to give it protection, yet to still allow it to receive l from the winter sun. Chance stands, puts his gloves back and continues his walk, disappearing into a remote sectio the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey stands holding the door for Eve and Allenby, all other cars have gone. Eve is worried, gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance walks through the woods, his pace faster than befo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limousine still waits for Chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is deeply concerned for Chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to find him, Robert - he could be lost, something may have happened, we can't leave him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really care for him, don't you, Eve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do - we do - both of us, Ben and I feel so much for Chauncey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we'd better go look for him.  (he taps on the glass partition)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David! David starts up the limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance walks with determination through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allenby and Eve search for Chance as David drives along a narrow road through the woods. Jeffrey, sitting in front, suddenly calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! About 100 yards ahead of them, Chance crosses the road, continues on down a hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is! Chauncey! David stops the limousine at the point where Chance cross Eve hurries out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance is about twenty yards down the side of a hill. Eve calls to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chauncey! Chauncey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops, looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Eve. Eve runs, half falls as she goes down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Chauncey...! She gets to him, holds him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Chauncey, darling... Where have you been? We thought we'd lost you - we've been looking all over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I've been looking for you, too, Eve. She hugs him one more time, then she leads him back up th hill to the waiting limousine. Allenby gets out of the ca greets Chance with a handshake and an arm around the shoulder. Then the three get into the limousine.
